Subjective: Sore throat x 3 days. Fever this AM. Started with cough last week, now resolved. Painful swallowing, unbearable. Took paracetamol and ibuprofen, minimal relief. No shortness of breath. Able to swallow liquids, but painful. No runny nose. Friend had abscess, concerned re: same. Had sore throat years ago, took antibiotics as child. Request: Wants antibiotics for faster recovery.
Objective: Temp 38.3 C. Ears: Left TM normal. Right ear canal slightly red. Neck: Small, non-pathological submandibular lymph nodes. Throat: Median uvula, slightly red pharyngeal arches, slightly enlarged tonsils bilaterally with some slough. Tonsils not kissing. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no adventitious sounds. O2 Sat: 98% on room air.
Assessment: Viral pharyngitis. No signs of peritonsillar abscess. Fever present.
Plan:
1. Explanation: Viral infection, antibiotics not indicated. 
2. Pain management: Continue paracetamol 500mg q6h PRN, ibuprofen 400mg q8h PRN. 
3. Hydration: Encourage fluids. Cold drinks/popsicles may help pain. 
4. Safety netting: Return if shortness of breath, inability to swallow, or worsening symptoms. 
5. Follow-up: As needed.
